{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3419222,"name":"Zac Keepers","username":"Zac-K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/ecae2f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-29T19:31:27.666Z","cooked":"

My rookie team is trying to figure out what swerve drive module we should buy before the season starts.

We’ve gone through a lot of CD posts comparing swerves, but we couldn’t find a good one comparing thrifty to SDS. This may be because it is still in pre order, but we were wondering if anyone had compared the two.

How would yall compare the Thrifty swerve module to SDS(Mk41 or Mk4n) in efficiency, price, power, and reliability?

A really big thing to us is to not have to continue buying different gearboxes or gears to change torque/ speed as we don’t know what our robot will be yet.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-08-29T19:31:27.666Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":673,"reads":589,"readers_count":588,"score":3482.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470464,"topic_slug":"thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve","display_username":"Zac Keepers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67642,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3419304,"name":"4573 Lead Mentor & Drive Coach ","username":"Skeller","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8e7dd6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-29T23:49:02.287Z","cooked":"

First welcome to FRC! I wish you best of luck this season.

Second, SDS is the staple of swerve and will give extreme reliability. However the gear ratios need to be purchased extra (through sds, AndyMark, or wcp). They have done well to iterate and improve swerve. We ran Mk4 this year for the corner size and I’m thankful of the new MK4c.

With Thrifty, they will give you all the gear ratios to swap in and out which is great season to season. If you read the write up from 1706 they tried to brake it and it lasted. Plus the weight saving techniques seem great!

IMO if you are a school based team and it’s hard to use money, and you prioritize being able to swap speeds, go with thrifty.
If you want modules that are used by a majority of teams and have a good backlog of information online go with sds.

Lastly, swerve doesn’t mean success, designing a good robot and making it robust will!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-08-29T23:49:02.287Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":551,"readers_count":550,"score":235.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470464,"topic_slug":"thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve","display_username":"4573 Lead Mentor & Drive Coach ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59165,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3419305,"name":"Galen Spooner","username":"GalenSpooner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galenspooner/{size}/229943_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-30T00:01:43.926Z","cooked":"

Another important thing is the software. I’m not sure if the Thrifty swerve is compatible with Cancoders, which are needed to use the CTRE swerve code generator which makes it super easy (20 minutes from start to working code for me) to get your swerve up and running. Our team ran Thrifty encoders for our first competition, which we had many issues with (Randomly reading extremely large or small numbers, shorting) but as soon as we switched to Cancoders those issues went away.

The SDS MK4 modules are also the same price as the Thrifty swerve (Though the Thrifty swerve is more similar to the MK4i), at $300.

If the Thrifty swerve is compatible with Cancoders, I would personally love to use it as it seems super great mechanically and at a very competitive price.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-08-30T00:01:43.926Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":24,"reads":511,"readers_count":510,"score":267.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470464,"topic_slug":"thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve","display_username":"Galen Spooner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60080,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2035 Captain, Software Lead, Driver, Design"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 2035 Captain, Software Lead, Driver, Design","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3419312,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-30T00:29:18.916Z","cooked":"
GalenSpooner:

Another important thing is the software. I’m not sure if the Thrifty swerve is compatible with Cancoders

Thrifty Swerve includes the Thrifty encoders, but the encoder in the photo appears to be the CANCoder-replacement case.

The current Thrifty Swerve is TTB’s second attempt at a swerve module, a couple teams ran development versions of it in 2024, they have a compelling price point on it, and TTB’s people know what it takes to put a competitive swerve on the field. The main knock on it is going to be that 2025 will be its first season in widespread availability, and I am always going to be cautious about dropping significant money on year-one products no matter which vendor it is. So you’re unlikely to see me run it next year, but I’m still rooting for their success.

you can use cancoders with Thrifty Swerve.

","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":5305,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3419317,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-30T00:45:27.475Z","cooked":"
Zac-K:

My rookie team is trying to figure out what swerve drive module we should buy before the season starts.

Emphasis mine.

Playing devils advocate here, assuming a full drivetrain:

What makes you think you need swerve as a rookie? Especially if there isn’t anyone on the team who has done swerve (especially software) before (I’m just guessing).

Are you ok with the substantial monetary and time investment into swerve? (Modules will physically last you many seasons with some minor costs and maintenance (tread, extra set of gearing for a future game, etc). Sustainably is both a money thing and a human time thing. You need ti have time, energy, noney, etc into other mechanisms, however, simple, robust, and practiced on swerve is one heck of a cimbo (team 27 in 2022 for instance)

Having said that:

Several months ahead if time is the correct mindset to pull this off, especially if you are meeting weekly or so.

Best of luck!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-08-30T00:48:25.884Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":429,"readers_count":428,"score":170.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":470464,"topic_slug":"thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/6","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3419325,"name":"Joe Schmo","username":"GenericUserPerson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-30T01:10:25.419Z","cooked":"

From what I’ve seen thrifty SwerveX is starting to be adopted more and more. A lot of high-level teams are beginning to use them too, which certainly helps things. I think if you give it a year or two it may just be that SwerveX is more widespread than SDS modules.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-08-30T01:42:15.406Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":401,"readers_count":400,"score":125.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470464,"topic_slug":"thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve","display_username":"Joe Schmo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":59165,"username":"Skeller","name":"4573 Lead Mentor & Drive Coach ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8e7dd6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58757,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot Connoisseur"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/7","custom_user_title":"Robot Connoisseur","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3419427,"name":"Emerson OHara","username":"Emerson1706","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerson1706/{size}/174702_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-30T14:13:47.439Z","cooked":"
GalenSpooner:

I’m not sure if the Thrifty swerve is compatible with Cancoders, which are needed to use the CTRE swerve code generator which makes it super easy (20 minutes from start to working code for me) to get your swerve up and running.

Thrifty Swerve is compatible with Cancoders and i think this is a good option for teams that want to be able to get up and running fast (and a good option overall). 1706 used PWM encoders into the sparkmax (similarly to how the maxswerve works) and that was pretty straight forwards. We are going to host a swerve workshop for local teams later this fall so will get sample code/libraries setup for different swerve configurations and i will make sure we share all that.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-08-30T17:57:03.007Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":372,"readers_count":371,"score":119.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470464,"topic_slug":"thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve","display_username":"Emerson OHara","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43759,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/8","custom_user_title":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3419437,"name":"Justin Foss","username":"Justin_Foss","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/justin_foss/{size}/254655_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-30T14:35:56.054Z","cooked":"

Which PWM encoder did 1706 use to connect into the sparkmax and was any custom cabling etc required to do so?

We used canandencoders and use the included ribbon cable straight into the sparkmax

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-08-30T14:36:36.537Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":348,"readers_count":347,"score":94.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470464,"topic_slug":"thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve","display_username":"Emerson OHara","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6805,"username":"Justin_Foss","name":"Justin Foss","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/justin_foss/{size}/254655_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43759,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-swerve-vs-sds-swerve/470464/10","custom_user_title":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3419696,"name":"Bryson Smith","username":"BrysonSmith","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brysonsmith/{size}/227306_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-31T15:23:23.455Z","cooked":"

My rookie team (9445) used swerve in the previous season. There were a few challenges that we experienced that may be important in your process.

  1. Software was a major challenge.

    • We used Neo motors for turn and drive, but CANCoders to measure the absolute rotation of our modules. This meant that we had to do more work since the REV templates and the CTRE templates are fairly particular. There were not easy, out of the box solutions for code in our case.
    • Tuning PID controllers can be very difficult. Once someone is familiar with them, they can be much faster, but if your software students are new to this kind of thing, be prepared for several hours of tuning and troubleshooting your first time.

  2. Having the right environment is very important.

    • I tuned my swerve drive on a relatively (in comparison to carpet) slick concrete floor. There were two big problems with this:
    1. We left many track marks on the floor. These are not very fun to clean up, and can be much worse when you are tuning, and the robot still drives “a little weird”
    2. When we showed up to our regional event, the robot had never driven on carpet. Our first practice match, we damaged a large portion of the robot because the swerve was not tuned for carpet. It could not drive well, and tuning between matches, while possible, is again not very fun, and is even less effective.

I wish you the best of luck in whatever your team decides to do throughout the off season and the competition season. Continue to use resources available to you, work hard, and you can do quite well. Welcome to FRC.
